img.alt: Bond refinancing could save taxpayers up to $10 million

a.span: Bond refinancing could save taxpayers up to $10 million

div.p: Taxpayers in the El Paso Independent School District could save up to $10 million in debt payments after the Board of Trustees agreed this week to refinance more than $212 million from voter-approved bonds issued in prior years.

a.title: Go to comments for Bond refinancing could save taxpayers up to $10 million

img.alt: EPISD opens online registration for 2020-21 school year

a.span: EPISD opens online registration for 2020-21 school year

div.p: Online registration began today in the El Paso Independent School District for the 2020-21 school year. Registration is open for all returning students as well as students new to EPISD, including students enrolling for the first time in pre-kindergarten and kindergarten.

a.title: Go to comments for EPISD opens online registration for 2020-21 school year

img.alt: EPISD changes meal distribution days to Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays to limit contact during COVID-19 pandemic

a.span: EPISD changes meal distribution days to Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays to limit contact during COVID-19 pandemic

div.p: Starting on Monday, April 20, EPISD will distribute meals for students on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays only. The shift in schedule will reduce the risk of COVID-19 infection for families and EPISD employees.

a.title: Go to comments for EPISD changes meal distribution days to Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays to limit contact during COVID-19 pandemic
